refnamediv.refpurpose: Load weather stations meta-data (location, validity time ...) into the WDB database. The original data is read from STINFOSYS database (so ... blame it if you don't like the data). The stationLoad work pretty much simple. It reads records and inserts them into WDB. It is up to WDB to handle the meta-data properly and consitently.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: stationLoad loads meta-data of the weather station(s) into the wdb database. The WDB database must be up and running for this program to work, unless one of the options: --help or --dry-run have been given on the command line.

The STINFOSYS (http://stinfosys) is considered as the authoritative source for weather stations at the met.no. STINFOSYS holds, among other things, information about station positions, their WMO number, internal ID, place name, validity dates and so on. Only internal ID is unique. WMO (synop) number is not defined for each station. The actual names of the palces are not unique. The internal IDs are used as value for placename within 88000 placenamespaceid. The WMO numbers are used as value for placename within 88001 placenamespaceid.
Pay atttention to the --after option. If ommited, the stationLoad will process all entries frim STINFOSYS. This is proper behavior for inital loading.
When --after defined, the stationLoad will process entries that were updated >= after value. This is proper behavior for stationary case.

Specify wdb palcenamespaceid where metadata is to be stored with stationid (within STINFOSYS) as value for place name. The default placenamespace is 88000.

Set output logfile. The default is to print to stdout

Dumps the list of SQL commands that would be sent to WDB. No execution takes place. Useful for debugging.

Lower bound on the update date for stations. Accepts several date formats (see man date), like: "Thu Aug 30 09:38:43 CEST 2012", "2012-08-21", "1997-07-16T19:20+01:00", "20012/08/21" etc. Use (double/single) quotes to delimit date value.
If the value is missing stationLoad will take all entries from STINFOSYS - god for inital wdb loading.

Specify the WDB user to connect as. The database user must have access to the wdb_grib role (this is will usually be the case if the stationLoad process is being run by the creator of the database).
Specify the database port to connect to (e.g., 5432).
Specify the STINFOSYS database name to connect to (e.g., stinfosys).
Specify the STINFOSYS host to connect to (e.g., somehost.met.no).
Specify the STINFOSYS user to connect as.
Specify the STINFOSYS port to connect to (e.g., 5432).

refsect1.title: Exit Status
refsect1.para: stationLoad returns 0 to the shell if it finished normally and 1 if a fatal error occured during loading (out of memory, database not found, etc.).

IMPORTANT: It has been noticed that STINFOSYS contains stations with different IDs but with same lon/lat. The WDB currently can't support such situation and will throw exception. The stationLoad tool will catch the exception, print out the message and continue to load other stations.
